test-case.name: fn-namespace-uri-1
test-case.description: Evaluation of the fn:namespace-uri function with an undefined context node and no argument.

test-case.name: fn-namespace-uri-2
test-case.description: Evaluation of the fn:namespace-uri function with more than one argument.

test-case.name: fn-namespace-uri-3
test-case.description: Evaluation of the fn:namespace-uri function with the context item not being a node.

test-case.name: fn-namespace-uri-4
test-case.description: Evaluation of the fn:namespace-uri function argument set to empty sequence.

test-case.name: fn-namespace-uri-5
test-case.description: Evaluation of the fn:namespace-uri function argument set to a comment node. Use the fn:count function to avoid empty file.

test-case.name: fn-namespace-uri-6
test-case.description: Evaluation of the fn:namespace-uri function argument set to a computed comment node.

test-case.name: fn-namespace-uri-7
test-case.description: Evaluation of the fn:namespace-uri function argument set to a processing instruction node.

test-case.name: fn-namespace-uri-8
test-case.description: Evaluation of the fn:namespace-uri function argument set to a constructed processing instruction node.

test-case.name: fn-namespace-uri-9
test-case.description: Evaluation of the fn:namespace-uri function argument set to a text node. Use the fn:count function to avoid empty file.

test-case.name: fn-namespace-uri-10
test-case.description: Evaluation of the fn:namespace-uri function argument set to an element node with no namespace. Use the fn:count function to avoid empty file.

test-case.name: fn-namespace-uri-11
test-case.description: Evaluation of the fn:namespace-uri function argument set to a computed element node with no namespace. Use the fn:count function to avoid empty file.

test-case.name: fn-namespace-uri-12
test-case.description: Evaluation of the fn:namespace-uri function argument set to an attribute node with no namespace. Use the fn:count function to avoid empty file.

test-case.name: fn-namespace-uri-13
test-case.description: Evaluation of the fn:namespace-uri function argument set to a computed attribute node with no namespace.

test-case.name: fn-namespace-uri-14
test-case.description: Evaluation of the fn:namespace-uri function argument set to an element node with no namespace queried from a file.

test-case.name: fn-namespace-uri-15
test-case.description: Evaluation of the fn:namespace-uri function argument set to an attribute node with no namespace queried from a file.

test-case.name: fn-namespace-uri-16
test-case.description: Evaluation of the fn:namespace-uri function with no argument. Use an element node with no namespace queried from a file.

test-case.name: fn-namespace-uri-17
test-case.description: Evaluation of the fn:namespace-uri function with argument set to a direct element node with a namespace attribute. Use the string function

test-case.name: fn-namespace-uri-18
test-case.description: Evaluation of the fn:namespace-uri function with argument set to a computed element node (with prefix) that uses a declared namespace attribute. Use the string function
test-case.test: declare namespace ex = "http://www.example.com/examples"; fn:string(fn:namespace-uri(element ex:anElement {"An Element Content"}))

test-case.name: fn-namespace-uri-19
test-case.description: Evaluation of the fn:namespace-uri function with argument set to a computed element node (with no prefix) that should not use a declared namespace attribute. Use the count function to avoid empty file.
test-case.test: declare namespace ex = "http://www.example.com/examples"; fn:namespace-uri(element anElement {"An Element Content"})

test-case.name: fn-namespace-uri-20
test-case.description: Evaluation of the fn:namespace-uri function with argument set to a direct element node (with no prefix) that should not use a declared namespace attribute. Use the count function to avoid empty file.
test-case.test: declare namespace ex = "http://www.example.com/examples"; fn:namespace-uri(<anElement>An Element Content</anElement>)

test-case.name: fn-namespace-uri-21
test-case.description: Evaluation of the fn:namespace-uri function with argument set to a direct element node with prefix that should use a declared namespace attribute. Use the string function.
test-case.test: declare namespace ex = "http://www.example.com/examples"; fn:namespace-uri(<ex:anElement>An Element Content</ex:anElement>)

test-case.name: fn-namespace-uri-22
test-case.description: Evaluation of the fn:namespace-uri function with argument set to a direct element node with no prefix that should use a declared defaultnamespace attribute. Use the string function.
test-case.test: declare default element namespace "http://www.example.com/examples"; fn:string(fn:namespace-uri(<anElement>An Element Content</anElement>))

test-case.name: fn-namespace-uri-23
test-case.description: Evaluation of the fn:namespace-uri function with argument set to a direct element node with prefix that should not used the declared defaultnamespace attribute. Use the string function.

test-case.name: fn-namespace-uri-24
test-case.description: Evaluation of the fn:namespace-uri function with argument set to a computed element node with prefix that should not used the declared defaultnamespace attribute. Use the string function.

test-case.name: fn-namespace-uri-25
test-case.description: Evaluation of the fn:namespace-uri function with argument set to a computed element node with prefix no that should used the declared default namespace attribute. Use the string function.

test-case.name: fn-namespace-uri-26
test-case.description: Evaluation of the fn:namespace-uri function with an undefined context node and argument set to ".".

test-case.name: K-NodeNamespaceURIFunc-1
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `namespace-uri((), "wrong param")`.

test-case.name: K-NodeNamespaceURIFunc-2
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `if(false()) then namespace-uri() else true()`.

test-case.name: K-NodeNamespaceURIFunc-3
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `namespace-uri(()) eq xs:anyURI("")`.

test-case.name: K2-NodeNamespaceURIFunc-1
test-case.description: Extract the namespace URI from a processing instruction node.

test-case.name: K2-NodeNamespaceURIFunc-2
test-case.description: Extract the namespace URI from a comment node.

test-case.name: K2-NodeNamespaceURIFunc-3
test-case.description: Extract the namespace URI from a text node.

test-case.name: cbcl-namespace-uri-001
test-case.description: test fn:boolean on fn:namespace-uri
